text:
Question 51) A new economy emerged on a global scale in the last quarter of the twentieth century. I call it informational, global and network to identify its fundamental and differentiated characteristics and emphasize its interconnection. It is informational because it basically depends on its ability to generate, efficiently process and apply knowledge -based information. It is global because its components are organized on a global scale, directly or through a network of connections between economic agents. It is a network because it is made in a global network of interaction between business networks.
CASTELLS, M. Network Society - The Information Age: Economics, what structural change is the result of the form of economic organization described in the text?
A) Serial manufacture.
B) Inventory expansion.
C) fragile cartels.
D) standardization of goods.
E) deterritorialization of production.
